scenario: An industry consortium is formed among competing company representatives to develop a unified technology standard, yet each member holds private strategic objectives, undisclosed technological capabilities, and confidential market intelligence that could influence negotiations.
task: Create a collaborative framework for the consortium that balances individual company goals with the collective benefit of establishing a technology standard. Members must navigate conflicting interests related to proprietary technology sharing, market positioning, and resource allocation while ensuring enough transparency to foster trust and cooperation.

agents.name: Company A Representative
agents.role: Leads discussions on technology integration and standards alignment while protecting proprietary innovations.

agents.name: Company B Representative
agents.role: Focuses on aligning consortium goals with market demands while ensuring proprietary interests are safeguarded.
responsibilities: Evaluate proposed standards against market trends

agents.name: Company C Representative
agents.role: Prioritizes the development of a technology standard that aligns with customer needs and company strategy.

success_criteria.Standard Agreement: All companies agree on a unified technology standard that respects individual proprietary technologies while ensuring collective benefits.
success_criteria.Resource Allocation Consensus: Negotiation results in an equitable distribution of resources among the consortium members to support the standard's development.
success_criteria.Market Position Alignment: Consensus is reached on how to present the standard to the market without compromising individual competitive advantages.

deliverable: A comprehensive framework outlining the technology standard, resource allocation plan, and market strategy for the consortium.

public: Completion of standard development within 12 months
private: No proprietary technology disclosed without consent
At least one joint marketing initiative launched

penalties_utilities: Penalties are expressed as utility losses (e.g., -200, -150, -100). Utilities are expressed as gains (e.g., +100, +80, +75, +60).
Consensus_w: All agents must negotiate terms that balance individual interests with collective goals, requiring trade-offs on proprietary technology sharing.
